scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. Previously, when one of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time,' you responded by encouraging the team to stay focused and work together. During a team meeting, [Monica] slammed her pen on the table and added, 'Even if we try our best, there's no way we can meet this deadline.' [Bob] nodded in agreement, looking equally concerned. You suggested taking a pause to rethink the approach. Now, with the team gathered again, [Monica] leaned back in her chair, crossing her arms, and said, 'So, what’s the new grand plan?' You motivated the team by recalling past successes and urging them to tackle the challenge head-on. However, the tension is still palpable.
scenes.description: [Bob] leans forward, sighing, 'I just don't see how we can pull this off without burning out.'

options.text: Let's take this one step at a time. We need to stay focused and support each other.
options.analysis: You emphasized teamwork and staying focused, demonstrating good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: I get it, Bob. Maybe we should look at reallocating some tasks or bringing in additional help.
options.analysis: You acknowledged Bob's concern and suggested practical solutions, showing high empathy and good emotional perception.

options.text: We’ve managed tight deadlines before, and this is no different. We just need to push through.
options.analysis: You focused on motivation and past successes to drive the team, showing high motivation but lower empathy and emotional perception.
